comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: "Maurice Tanquary taught entomology for several years at Kansas State Agricultural College before joining the Texas Agricultural Experiment Station in 1919 as chief of the division of entomology. Tanquary was interested in apiculture and resigned in 1923 to enter professional beekeeping in North Dakota. He later joined the University of Minnesota in apiculture and remained there until 1944. " entohistory.tamu.edu/hallofhonor/hallofhonor.html

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Photo is dated in reverse, June 27, 1913, just before Professor Tanquary became a member of the ill-fated Crocker Land Expedition, an arctic exploring party. It took him 100 days to make a 1300-mile sledge trip out of the frozen north. Here is his report in the New York Times: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9402E...

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the information and for noting the date on the negative.  We can add that to the description when we update it.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maurice_Cole_Tanquary en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crocker_Land_Expedition
